data.message:
[graal] Allow execution from command line

This patch allows to execute graal backends from commandline. To cope
with this modification, the organization of the repository has been
changed.

the `graal_version` within the metadata information.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[lint] Add quality check analyzer for Python projects

This code includes lint, a wrapper for the Pylint package, which
enables to perform quality checks on Python projects.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message: [analyzer] Add version information

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[reverse] Add package and class dependency analyzer for Python project

This code include reverse, a wrapper for the Pyreverse library,
which allows to calculate graph dependencies for class and packages.
The graph is delivered as a JSON to ease the analysis via
JavaScript tools.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[codep] Add backend to calculate source code dependencies

This code includes a new backend, codepn, which allows to
calculate dependencies among classes and packages within a Python
project or module.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[coqua] Add backend to assess code quality of Python projects

This code includes a new backend, coqua, which allows to
assess the quality of a Python project or module.

data.message: [setup] Include dependencies for new backends and analyzers

data.message:
[bandit] Add vulnerability analyzer for Python project

This code includes a wrapper for bandit,  a tool designed to find
common security issues in Python code.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[covuln] Add backend to support vulnerabilities analysis for Python code

This code includes `covuln`, a backend that scans Python projects for
security issues. It relies on the Bandit library.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[graal] Move fetch parameters to init

This code moves the parameters of the `fetch` method to the
`__init__` method. Furthermore, new parameters are added to ease
the tuning of the analysis (files filtered in and out, entrypoint
and fine-grained details).

This code replaces the parameter `git_path` to `gitpath` to ease
the integration with arthur. Thus git and graal tasks share some
common parameters.

data.message:
[colic] Add new backend to get license information

This code introduces CoLic, a new backend to fetch license information.
It relies on Nomos, a script part of the fossology project to extract
licenses data from source code.

data.message:
[graal] Add command argument parser for Graal

This code includes a command parser tailored to Graal. It
defines and parses a set of arguments common to backends
commands, such as from_date, to_data and exec_path.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cocom] Optimize code complexity analysis

This code allows to launch code complexity analysis only over the
files included/changed within a commit.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[colic] Add support for scancode analyzer

This code extends the colic backend by adding support for the
scancode analyzer.  Currently, the backend supports nomos and
scancode analyzers, they can be activated by passing the
corresponding category (`code_license_nomos`,
`code_license_scancode`).
Note that the backend requires the local path where the
executable is located.

data.Author: inishchith <inishchith@gmail.com>
data.message:
[colic] Add support of scancode_cli and it's corresponding tests to colic backend

A faster version of scancode is now added to colic backend
scancode_cli usage:

colic https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab-toolkit
--git-path /tmp/scancode_cli
--exec-path /home/scancode-toolkit/etc/scripts/scancli.py
--category code_license_scancode_cli

Added tests for scancode_cli analyzer which also required updating tests
for in-place implementation of colic backend.

Signed-off-by: inishchith <inishchith@gmail.com>

data.Author: inishchith <inishchith@gmail.com>
data.message:
[travis] Update scancode-toolkit configuration

We're now using a clone of scancode-toolkit instead of a release, as the
latest release is of 15th February 2019 and the scancli.py script was
incroporated later i.e 5th March 2019 and there hasn't been a release
since.

Add stable scancode_cli checkout commit in order to accomodate functioning
of both scancode & scancode_cli

Signed-off-by: inishchith <inishchith@gmail.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Add base class to handle setup of test Git repo

This code refactors the tests for backends by centralizing
the methods to set up and tear down the tests to the new
class `TestBaseRepo`.

This change is needed to speed up the creation of tests by
reducing the boilerplate code.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Add base class to handle tests on analyzers

This code refactors the tests for analyzers by centralizing
the methods to set up and tear down the tests to the new
class `TestCaseAnalyzer`.

This change is needed to speed up the creation of tests by
reducing the boilerplate code.

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[graal] Change logic to create worktree

This code changes the logic to create the worktree.
The default branch is used to initialize the worktree,
if no branch is passed as input. Otherwise the latter
is used to initialize the worktree.

This change is needed to handle repositories not
having the branch `master` or which default branch
is not `master`.

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'change-logic-worktree' of 'https://github.com/valeriocos/grimoirelab-graal'

Merges #76

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[graal] Fix worktree creation

This code makes sure to create a worktree from the default branch or from the first
branch passed via the param `branches`. This change is needed since currently
Graal doesn't support multiple worktrees.

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:

parameters of graal. This change is needed to
simplify the use of external tools.

Backends and tests have been updated accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[analyzers] Add support for Jadolint

This code includes Jadolint, a new analyzer to
process Dockerfile. In this first version, Jadolint
is used to identify dependencies in Dockerfiles.

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[codep] Add support for Docker dependencies analysis

This code enhances the codep backend with the support
to extract dependencies collected from Dockerfiles.

An example to get such data is provided below:
```
codep
https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab
--git-path
/tmp/test
--category
code_dependencies_jadolint
--exec-path
.../crossJadolint/target/jadolint.jar
--in-paths
Dockerfile
Dockerfile-full
Dockerfile-secured
Dockerfile-factory
Dockerfile-installed
```

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[tests] Add travis support for Jadolint

This code modifies the .travis.yml file by
adding the steps needed to download and build
Jadolint.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[coqua] Add support for Docker smells analysis

This code enhances the coqua backend with the support
to extract smells collected from Dockerfiles.

An example to get such data is provided below:
```
codep
https://github.com/chaoss/grimoirelab
--git-path
/tmp/test
--category
code_quality_jadolint
--exec-path
.../crossJadolint/target/jadolint.jar
--in-paths
Dockerfile
Dockerfile-full
Dockerfile-secured
Dockerfile-factory
Dockerfile-installed
```

Tests have been added accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[travis] Upgrade setuptools and pip

This code upgrades the setuptools and pip. This change
is needed to fix the CI tests that were failing due
to the following error:
```
Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 154, in save_modules
        yield saved
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 195, in setup_context
        yield
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 250, in run_setup
        _execfile(setup_script, ns)
      File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.5.6/lib/python3.5/site-packages/setuptools/sandbox.py", line 44, in _execfile
        code = compile(script, filename, 'exec')
      File "/tmp/easy_install-wu9lgsxc/pandoc-2.0a4/setup.py", line 11
        error = f"pip is not installed, refer to <{url}> for instructions."
                                                                          ^
    SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Quan Zhou <zhquan7@gmail.com>

[travis] Upgrade setuptools and pip

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cocom] Include files info in docs generated

This code includes the `files` info to the documents
returned by the cocom backend. This change allows to have
a global info over all the files present in a specific git
revision.

Tests have been updated accordingly.
Backend version is now 0.6.0

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[travis] Change how to install nomos

This code changes the way how to install the nomos. Thus,
instead of creating the executable, it relies on the deb
packages fossology-common and fossology-nomos.

Due to the missing dependency libjson-c3 in the defaul distribution
used by Travis (`xenial`), the distribution has been set to `bionic`.

The nomossa executable path has been updated accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'update-travis-nomos' of 'https://github.com/valeriocos/grimoirelab-graal'

Merges #96
Closes #96
Fixes #93

data.Author: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cocom] Remove first slash from file path

This code removes the first slash from the
paths includes in the files attribute.

Signed-off-by: Valerio Cosentino <valcos@bitergia.com>

Update version number to 0.2.9

data.Author: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[travis] Update .travis.yml

This code aims at aligning the CI tests across the
different grimoirelab components.

Python 3.5 is removed as its support period has ended and
Python 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8 are now supported.

The version of setuptools and pip has been downgraded as a
hotfix to solve the failing CI tests.

The version of Go is updated to the most stable version to
align it with the scc tool requirement.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
Merge branch 'fix-travis-build' of 'https://github.com/vchrombie/grimoirelab-graal'

Merges #98
Closes #98

data.Author: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[CI] Migrate from Travis CI to GitHub Actions

Travis CI has brought a few changes in its plans
which is causing friction to the current workflow.

This commit removes the support of Travis CI and adds
the support of GitHub Actions as the new CI service.

Signed-off-by: Venu Vardhan Reddy Tekula <venu@bitergia.com>
